Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ حُرٌّ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in others] is freedom

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ عِتْقٌ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in others] is liberty

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ مَسْلَاةٌ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in this world] is a solace

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ غَنَاءٌ حَاضِرٌ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in this world] is a ready affluence

Wisdom: الْعِزُّ مَعَ الْيَأْسِ
enWisdom: With loss of hope [in others] comes honour

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ يُرِيحُ [مُرِيحُ‏] النَّفْسِ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in others] comforts the soul

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ عِتْقٌ مُجَدَّدٌ [مُحَدَّدٌ]
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in others] is a renewed liberty

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ عِتْقٌ مُرِيحٌ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in others] is a comforting liberty

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ يُعِزُّ [يغر] الْأَسِيرَ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in others] exalts the prisoner

Wisdom: الْكَفُّ عَمَّا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ عِفَّةٌ وَكِبَرُ هِمَّةٍ
enWisdom: Restraining oneself from [coveting] that which people possess is chastity and high-mindedness

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ خَيْرٌ مِنَ التَّضَرُّعِ [الضرع‏] إِلَى النَّاسِ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in others] is better than entreating the people [for what you need]

Wisdom: الْيَأْسُ أَحَدُ النُّجْحَيْنِ
enWisdom: Loss of hope [in others] is one of the two successes

Wisdom: الْكَفُّ عَمَّا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ أَحَدُ السَّخَاءَيْنِ
enWisdom: Restraining yourself from that which others possess is one of the two generosities

Wisdom: أَصْلُ الْإِخْلَاصِ الْيَأْسُ مِمَّا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ
enWisdom: The root of sincerity is losing hope [and desire] in that which others possess

Wisdom: بِالْيَأْسِ يَكُونُ الْغَنَاءُ [الفناء]
enWisdom: Through loss of hope [in others] there is [attainment of] self-sufficiency

Wisdom: تَحَلَّ بِالْيَأْسِ مِمَّا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ تَسْلَمْ مِنْ غَوَائِلِهِمْ وَتُحْرِزِ الْمَوَدَّةَ مِنْهُمْ
enWisdom: Adorn yourself with loss of hope in that which people possess and you will become safe from their malice and you will acquire their affection

Wisdom: ظَلَفُ النَّفْسِ عَمَّا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ هُوَ الْغِنَى الْمَوْجُودُ
enWisdom: Restraining oneself from that which is in the possession of [other] people is present affluence

Wisdom: مَنْ بَاعَ الطَّمَعَ بِالْيَأْسِ لَمْ يَسْتَطِلْ [لَمْ يَسْتَطْلِعْ‏] عَلَيْهِ النَّاسُ
enWisdom: One who trades covetousness for loss of hope [and desire for what others posses], the people will not treat him with contempt

Wisdom: مَنْ أَيِسَ [آيس‏] مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ سَلَا عَنْهُ
enWisdom: One who loses hope in a thing forgets about it

Wisdom: مَرَارَةُ الْيَأْسِ خَيْرٌ مِنَ التَّضَرُّعِ إِلَى النَّاسِ
enWisdom: The bitterness of despair is better than turning entreatingly towards the people

Wisdom: نَالَ الْغِنَى مَنْ رُزِقَ الْيَأْسَ عَمَّا فِي أَيْدِي النَّاسِ وَالْقَنَاعَةَ بِمَا أُوتِيَ وَالرِّضَا بِالْقَضَاءِ
enWisdom: He who has been granted hopelessness in [obtaining] what people possess, contentment with what he is given and satisfaction with the divine decree has acquired affluence

Wisdom: الرِّجَالُ تُفِيدُ [تُفْسِدُ] الْمَالَ الْمَالُ مَا أَفَادَ الرِّجَالَ
enWisdom: People serve wealth, wealth does not serve people

Wisdom: الْقَنَاعَةُ عُنْوَانُ الْفَاقَةِ
enWisdom: Contentment is the helper of poverty

Wisdom: الْبَذْلُ مَادَّةُ الْإِمْكَانِ
enWisdom: Generosity is the expander of ability

Wisdom: النَّفْسُ الشَّرِيفَةُ لَا تَثْقُلُ عَلَيْهَا الْمَئُونَاتُ
enWisdom: The honourable soul does not find it difficult to [spend wealth in order to] acquire provisions

Wisdom: اغْتَنِمْ مَنِ اسْتَقْرَضَكَ فِي حَالِ غِنَاكَ لِيَجْعَلَ قَضَاءَهُ فِي يَوْمِ عُسْرَتِكَ
enWisdom: Take benefit from the one who takes a loan from you in your time of prosperity so that you may take its repayment in your time of hardship

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمَقَاعِدَ الْأَسْوَاقِ فَإِنَّهَا مَعَارِضُ الْفِتَنِ وَمَحَاضِرُ الشَّيْطَانِ
enWisdom: Be wary of the sitting in the marketplaces, for indeed they are the locations of mischief and the visiting places of Satan

Wisdom: إِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِعَبْدٍ خَيْراً أَعَفَّ بَطْنَهُ وَفَرْجَهُ
enWisdom: When Allah wishes good for a servant, He safeguards his stomach and private parts from the unlawful

Wisdom: إِذَا أَرَادَ اللَّهُ بِعَبْدٍ خَيْراً أَعَفَّ بَطْنَهُ عَنِ الطَّعَامِ وَفَرْجَهُ عَنِ الْحَرَامِ
enWisdom: When Allah wishes good for a servant, He makes his stomach abstain from [unlawful] food and his private parts from that which is forbidden

Wisdom: بِرُكُوبِ الْأَهْوَالِ تُكْتَسَبُ الْأَمْوَالُ
enWisdom: It is by overcoming [one’s] fears that wealth is acquired

Wisdom: بِئْسَ الْقُوتُ أَكْلُ مَالِ الْأَيْتَامِ
enWisdom: How bad a sustenance consuming the wealth of orphans is!

Wisdom: حَصِّنُوا أَمْوَالَكُمْ بِالزَّكَاةِ
enWisdom: Fortify [and protect] your wealth by [giving] charity

Wisdom: رِزْقُ الْمَرْءِ عَلَى قَدْرِ نِيَّتِهِ
enWisdom: The sustenance of a person is proportionate to his intention

Wisdom: شَارِكُوا الَّذِي قَدْ أَقْبَلَ عَلَيْهِ الرِّزْقُ فَإِنَّهُ أَجْدَرُ بِالْحَظِّ وَأَخْلَقُ بِالْغِنَى
enWisdom: stablish partnership with the one to whom sustenance has drawn near, for verily he is worthier of success and more befitting of prosperity

Wisdom: مَنْ أَقْرَضَ اللَّهَ جَزَاهُ
enWisdom: One who gives a loan to Allah is recompensed by Him

Wisdom: مَنْ أَدَّى زَكَاةَ مَالِهِ وُقِيَ شُحَّ نَفْسِهِ
enWisdom: One who pays his zak?t is protected from the greediness of his soul

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يُنْصِفْكَ مِنْهُ حَيَاؤُهُ لَمْ يُنْصِفْكَ مِنْهُ دِينُهُ
enWisdom: One who does not show fairness to you out of his [sense of] shame will not be fair with you because of his religion
